001package squidpony.squidgrid;
002
003import squidpony.squidmath.*;
004
005import java.io.Serializable;
006import java.util.*;
007
008/**
009 * A randomized flood-fill implementation that fills from multiple start points at a time. Typical usage will either
010 * want the in-order-of-expansion result of {@link #start(List, int, Collection)}, which returns an ArrayList of the
011 * different separate spills, with each spill as its own ArrayList of Coord, or may want the all-at-once final result
012 * of all cells that received a spill and which point spilled out onto each given area, which is filled into
013 * {@link #spillMap} when {@link #start(List, int, Collection)} is called.
014 * <br>
015 * This is a pretty complex class, but it can be worthwhile for certain kinds of effect. It's used in
016 * {@link squidpony.squidgrid.mapping.PoliticalMapper} to assign claims to territory by nations or other factions, and
017 * helps ensure that the edges of territories are naturally-shaped.
018 * <br>
019 * Created by Tommy Ettinger on 4/7/2015.
020 */
021public class MultiSpill implements Serializable {
022    private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
023
024    /**
025     * This affects how distance is measured on diagonal directions vs. orthogonal directions. MANHATTAN should form a
026     * diamond shape on a featureless map, while CHEBYSHEV and EUCLIDEAN will form a square. If you only call
027     * Spill.start() once, you should strongly prefer MANHATTAN, even if the rest of the game uses another
028     * measurement, because CHEBYSHEV and EUCLIDEAN can produce odd, gap-filled flood-fills.  Any case where you have
029     * too many gaps can be corrected to varying extent by calling start() more than once with slowly increasing values.
030     * Because start() will extend from the existing area of the Spill, holes are likely to be filled after a few calls,
031     * but if the last call to start() tries to fill too many more cells than the previous one, it can cause holes on
032     * the periphery of the Spill area.
033     */
034    public Measurement measurement = Measurement.MANHATTAN;
035
036
037    /**
038     * Stores which parts of the map are accessible (with a value of true) and which are not (with a value of false,
039     * including both walls and unreachable sections of the map). Should not be changed unless the actual physical
040     * terrain has changed. You should call initialize() with a new map instead of changing this directly.
041     */
042    public boolean[][] physicalMap;
043    /**
044     * The cells that are filled by the a spiller with index n when it reaches its volume or limits will be equal to n;
045     * others will be -1.
046     */
047    public short[][] spillMap;
048
049    /**
050     * The cells that are filled by the any spiller will be true, others will be false.
051     */
052    protected GreasedRegion anySpillMap,
053
054    /**
055     * The cells that are considered fresh in any spill map will be true, others will be false.
056     */
057    anyFreshMap;
058
059    /**
060     * Each key here is an initial point for a spiller passed to start(), and each value corresponds to a list of points
061     * that the spiller will randomly fill, starting with the key, in order of when they are reached.
062     */
063    public ArrayList<ArrayList<Coord>> spreadPattern;
064    /**
065     * Height of the map. Exciting stuff. Don't change this, instead call initialize().
066     */
067    public int height;
068    /**
069     * Width of the map. Exciting stuff. Don't change this, instead call initialize().
070     */
071    public int width;
072    /**
073     * The amount of cells filled by this Spill, which may be less than the volume passed to start() if the boundaries
074     * are reached on all sides and the Spill has no more room to fill.
075     */
076    public int filled;
077    private ArrayList<OrderedSet<Coord>> fresh;
078    /**
079     * The IRNG used to decide how to randomly fill a space; can have its state set and read.
080     */
081    public IRNG rng;
082
083    private boolean initialized;
084    /**
085     * Construct a Spill without a level to actually scan. If you use this constructor, you must call an
086     * initialize() method before using this class.
087     */
088    public MultiSpill() {
089        rng = new StatefulRNG();
090
091        fresh = new ArrayList<>();
092    }
093    /**
094     * Construct a Spill without a level to actually scan. This constructor allows you to specify an RNG, but the actual
095     * RandomnessSource the RNG that this object uses will not be identical to the one passed as random (64 bits will
096     * be requested from the passed RNG, and that will be used to seed this class' RNG).
097     *
098     * If you use this constructor, you must call an  initialize() method before using this class.
099     * @param random an RNG that will be converted to a StatefulRNG if it is not one already
100     */
101    public MultiSpill(IRNG random) {
102        this(random.nextLong());
103    }
104
105    /**
106     * Construct a Spill without a level to actually scan. This constructor allows you to specify the state to be used
107     * for the RNG without actually passing an RNG, since this will use its own anyway.
108     *
109     * If you use this constructor, you must call an  initialize() method before using this class.
110     * @param state the state to use for this class' random number generator
111     */
112    public MultiSpill(long state) {
113        rng = new StatefulRNG(state);
114        fresh = new ArrayList<>();
115    }
116    /**
117     * Construct a Spill without a level to actually scan. This constructor allows you to specify an IStatefulRNG that
118     * will be used exactly, without copying the generator. This permits using {@link GWTRNG} instead of the default
119     * {@link StatefulRNG} if optimal performance on GWT is desirable at the expense of some performance on desktop.
120     *
121     * If you use this constructor, you must call an  initialize() method before using this class.
122     * @param random an IStatefulRNG that will be used exactly, without copying
123     */
124    public MultiSpill(IStatefulRNG random) {
125        rng = random;
126        fresh = new ArrayList<>();
127    }
128
129    /**
130     * Used to construct a Spill from the output of another.
131     * @param level a short[][] that should have been the spillMap of another MultiSpill
132     */
133    public MultiSpill(final short[][] level) {
134        rng = new StatefulRNG();
135
136        initialize(level);
137    }
138    /**
139     * Used to construct a Spill from the output of another, specifying a distance calculation.
140     * @param level a short[][] that should have been the spillMap of another MultiSpill
141     * @param measurement a Spill.Measurement that should usually be MANHATTAN
142     */
143    public MultiSpill(final short[][] level, Measurement measurement) {
144        rng = new StatefulRNG();
145
146        this.measurement = measurement;
147
148        initialize(level);
149    }
150    /**
151     * Used to construct a Spill from the output of another, specifying a distance calculation and RNG.
152     * <br>
153     * This constructor allows you to specify an RNG, but the actual RandomnessSource the RNG that this object uses will
154     * not be identical to the one passed as random (64 bits will be requested from the passed RNG, and that will be
155     * used to seed this class' RNG).
156     *
157     * @param level a short[][] that should have been the spillMap of another MultiSpill
158     * @param measurement a Spill.Measurement that should usually be MANHATTAN
159     */
160    public MultiSpill(final short[][] level, Measurement measurement, IRNG random) {
161        rng = new StatefulRNG(random.nextLong());
162
163        this.measurement = measurement;
164
165        initialize(level);
166    }
167
168    /**
169     * Constructor meant to take a char[][] returned by DungeonBoneGen.generate(), or any other
170     * char[][] where '#' means a wall and anything else is a walkable tile. If you only have
171     * a map that uses box-drawing characters, use DungeonUtility.linesToHashes() to get a
172     * map that can be used here.
173     *
174     * @param level a char[][] that should use '#' for walls and '.' for floors
175     */
176    public MultiSpill(final char[][] level) {
177        rng = new StatefulRNG();
178
179        initialize(level);
180    }
181    /**
182     * Constructor meant to take a char[][] returned by DungeonBoneGen.generate(), or any other
183     * char[][] where one char means a wall and anything else is a walkable tile. If you only have
184     * a map that uses box-drawing characters, use DungeonUtility.linesToHashes() to get a
185     * map that can be used here. You can specify the character used for walls.
186     *
187     * @param level a char[][] that should use alternateWall for walls and '.' for floors
188     * @param alternateWall the char to use for walls
189     */
190    public MultiSpill(final char[][] level, char alternateWall) {
191        rng = new StatefulRNG();
192
193        initialize(level, alternateWall);
194    }
195
196    /**
197     * Constructor meant to take a char[][] returned by DungeonBoneGen.generate(), or any other
198     * char[][] where '#' means a wall and anything else is a walkable tile. If you only have
199     * a map that uses box-drawing characters, use DungeonUtility.linesToHashes() to get a
200     * map that can be used here. This constructor specifies a distance measurement.
201     *
202     * @param level a char[][] that should use '#' for walls and '.' for floors
203     * @param measurement a Spill.Measurement that should usually be MANHATTAN
204     */
205    public MultiSpill(final char[][] level, Measurement measurement) {
206        rng = new StatefulRNG();
207        this.measurement = measurement;
208
209        initialize(level);
210    }
211    /**
212     * Constructor meant to take a char[][] returned by DungeonBoneGen.generate(), or any other
213     * char[][] where '#' means a wall and anything else is a walkable tile. If you only have
214     * a map that uses box-drawing characters, use DungeonUtility.linesToHashes() to get a
215     * map that can be used here. This constructor specifies a distance measurement.
216     * <br>
217     * This constructor allows you to specify an RNG, but the actual RandomnessSource the RNG that this object uses will
218     * not be identical to the one passed as random (64 bits will be requested from the passed RNG, and that will be
219     * used to seed this class' RNG).
220     * @param level a char[][] that should use '#' for walls and '.' for floors
221     * @param measurement a Spill.Measurement that should usually be MANHATTAN
222     * @param random an RNG that will be converted to a StatefulRNG if it is not one already
223     */
224    public MultiSpill(final char[][] level, Measurement measurement, IRNG random) {
225        rng = new StatefulRNG(random.nextLong());
226        this.measurement = measurement;
227
228        initialize(level);
229    }
230
231    /**
232     * Used to initialize or re-initialize a Spill that needs a new PhysicalMap because it either wasn't given
233     * one when it was constructed, or because the contents of the terrain have changed permanently.
234     * @param level a short[][] that should have been the spillMap of another MultiSpill
235     * @return this for chaining
236     */
237    public MultiSpill initialize(final short[][] level) {
238        fresh = new ArrayList<>();
239        width = level.length;
240        height = level[0].length;
241        spillMap = new short[width][height];
242        anySpillMap = new GreasedRegion(level, 1, 0x7fff);
243        anyFreshMap = new GreasedRegion(width, height);
244        physicalMap = new boolean[width][height];
245        for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
246            for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
247                spillMap[x][y] = level[x][y];
248                physicalMap[x][y] = level[x][y] >= 0;
249            }
250        }
251        initialized = true;
252        return this;
253    }
254
255    /**
256     * Used to initialize or re-initialize a Spill that needs a new PhysicalMap because it either wasn't given
257     * one when it was constructed, or because the contents of the terrain have changed permanently (not if a
258     * creature moved; for that you pass the positions of creatures that block paths to scan() or findPath() ).
259     * @param level a char[][] that should use '#' for walls and '.' for floors
260     * @return this for chaining
261     */
262    public MultiSpill initialize(final char[][] level) {
263        fresh = new ArrayList<>();
264        width = level.length;
265        height = level[0].length;
266        spillMap = new short[width][height];
267        anySpillMap = new GreasedRegion(width, height);
268        anyFreshMap = new GreasedRegion(width, height);
269        physicalMap = new boolean[width][height];
270        for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
271            for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
272                spillMap[x][y] = -1;
273                physicalMap[x][y] = level[x][y] != '#';
274            }
275        }
276        initialized = true;
277        return this;
278    }
279
280    /**
281     * Used to initialize or re-initialize a Spill that needs a new PhysicalMap because it either wasn't given
282     * one when it was constructed, or because the contents of the terrain have changed permanently (not if a
283     * creature moved; for that you pass the positions of creatures that block paths to scan() or findPath() ). This
284     * initialize() method allows you to specify an alternate wall char other than the default character, '#' .
285     * @param level a char[][] that should use alternateWall for walls and '.' for floors
286     * @param alternateWall the char to use for walls
287     * @return this for chaining
288     */
289    public MultiSpill initialize(final char[][] level, char alternateWall) {
290        fresh = new ArrayList<>();
291        width = level.length;
292        height = level[0].length;
293        spillMap = new short[width][height];
294        anySpillMap = new GreasedRegion(width, height);
295        anyFreshMap = new GreasedRegion(width, height);
296        physicalMap = new boolean[width][height];
297        for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
298            for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
299                spillMap[x][y] = -1;
300                physicalMap[x][y] = level[x][y] != alternateWall;
301            }
302        }
303        initialized = true;
304        return this;
305    }
306
307    /**
308     * Resets the spillMap to being empty.
309     */
310    public void resetMap() {
311        if(!initialized) return;
312        anySpillMap.clear();
313        for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
314            for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
315                spillMap[x][y] = -1;
316            }
317        }
318    }
319
320    /**
321     * Resets this Spill to a state with an empty spillMap and an empty spreadPattern.
322     */
323    public void reset() {
324        resetMap();
325        spreadPattern.clear();
326        fresh.clear();
327        anyFreshMap.clear();
328    }
329
330    /**
331     * Reverts a cell to an unfilled state (false in spillMap).
332     * @param x the x-component of the Coord to revert to an unfilled state
333     * @param y the y-component of the Coord to revert to an unfilled state
334     */
335    public void resetCell(int x, int y) {
336        if(!initialized) return;
337        spillMap[x][y] = -1;
338        anySpillMap.remove(x, y);
339    }
340
341    /**
342     * Reverts a cell to an unfilled state (false in spillMap).
343     * @param pt the Coord to revert to an unfilled state
344     */
345    public void resetCell(Coord pt) {
346        if(!initialized) return;
347        spillMap[pt.x][pt.y] = -1;
348        anySpillMap.remove(pt);
349    }
350
351    protected void setFresh(int idx, int x, int y) {
352        if(!initialized) return;
353        fresh.get(idx).add(Coord.get(x, y));
354        anyFreshMap.insert(x, y);
355    }
356
357    protected void setFresh(int idx, final Coord pt) {
358        if(!initialized) return;
359        if(anyFreshMap.contains(pt.x, pt.y))
360            return;
361        fresh.get(idx).add(pt);
362        anyFreshMap.insert(pt);
363    }
364
365    /**
366     * Recalculate the spillMap and return the spreadPattern. The cell corresponding to a Coord in entries will be true,
367     * the cells near each of those will be true if chosen at random from all passable cells adjacent to a
368     * filled (true) cell, and all other cells will be false. This takes a total number of cells to attempt
369     * to fill (the volume parameter), which can be negative to simply fill the whole map, and will fill less if it has
370     * completely exhausted all passable cells from all sources in entries.
371     * If the measurement this Spill uses is anything other than MANHATTAN, you can expect many gaps in the first
372     * filled area.  Subsequent calls to start() with the same entry and a higher volume will expand the area
373     * of the Spill, and are likely to fill any gaps after a few subsequent calls. Increasing the volume slowly
374     * is the best way to ensure that gaps only exist on the very edge if you use a non-MANHATTAN measurement.
375     *
376     * @param entries the first cell for each spiller to spread from, which should really be passable.
377     * @param volume the total number of cells to attempt to fill; if negative will fill the whole map.
378     * @param impassable a Collection, ideally a Set or GreasedRegion, holding Coord items representing the locations of
379     *                   moving obstacles to a fill that cannot be moved through; null means no obstacles exist.
380     * @return an ArrayList of Points that this will enter, in order starting with entry at index 0, until it
381     * reaches its volume or fills its boundaries completely.
382     */
383    public ArrayList<ArrayList<Coord>> start(List<Coord> entries, int volume, Collection<Coord> impassable) {
384        if(!initialized) return null;
385        if(volume < 0)
386            volume = Integer.MAX_VALUE;
387        ArrayList<Coord> spillers = new ArrayList<>(entries);
388        spreadPattern = new ArrayList<>(spillers.size());
389        fresh.clear();
390        filled = 0;
391        boolean hasFresh = false;
392        for (short i = 0; i < spillers.size(); i++) {
393            spreadPattern.add(new ArrayList<Coord>(128));
394            OrderedSet<Coord> os = new OrderedSet<>(128);
395            fresh.add(os);
396            Coord c = spillers.get(i);
397            spillMap[c.x][c.y] = i;
398            if(impassable == null || !impassable.contains(c)) {
399                os.add(c);
400                hasFresh = true;
401            }
402        }
403        Direction[] dirs = (measurement == Measurement.MANHATTAN) ? Direction.CARDINALS : Direction.OUTWARDS;
404        OrderedSet<Coord> currentFresh;
405        while (hasFresh && filled < volume) {
406            hasFresh = false;
407            for (short i = 0; i < spillers.size() && filled < volume; i++) {
408                currentFresh = fresh.get(i);
409                if(currentFresh.isEmpty())
410                    continue;
411                else
412                    hasFresh = true;
413                Coord cell = currentFresh.randomItem(rng);//.toArray(new Coord[currentFresh.size()])[rng.nextInt(currentFresh.size())];
414
415                spreadPattern.get(i).add(cell);
416                spillMap[cell.x][cell.y] = i;
417                filled++;
418                anySpillMap.insert(cell.x, cell.y);
419
420                for (int d = 0; d < dirs.length; d++) {
421                    Coord adj = cell.translate(dirs[d].deltaX, dirs[d].deltaY);
422                    if(!adj.isWithin(width, height))
423                        continue;
424                    double h = heuristic(dirs[d]);
425                    if (physicalMap[adj.x][adj.y] && !anySpillMap.contains(adj.x, adj.y) && (impassable == null || !impassable.contains(adj)) && rng.nextDouble(h) <= 1.0) {
426                        setFresh(i, adj);
427                    }
428                }
429                currentFresh.remove(cell);
430                anyFreshMap.remove(cell.x, cell.y);
431            }
432        }
433        return spreadPattern;
434    }
435
436    /**
437     * Recalculate the spillMap and return the spreadPattern. The cell corresponding to a key in entries will be true,
438     * the cells near each of those will be true if chosen at random from all passable cells adjacent to a
439     * filled (true) cell, and all other cells will be false. This takes a total number of cells to attempt
440     * to fill (the volume parameter), which can be negative to simply fill the whole map, and will fill less if it has
441     * completely exhausted all passable cells from all sources in entries. It uses the values in entries to determine
442     * whether it should advance from a particular key in that step or not; this choice is pseudo-random. If you have
443     * some values that are at or near 1.0 and some values that are closer to 0.0, you should expect the keys for the
444     * higher values to spread further out than the keys associated with lower values.
445     * <br>
446     * If the measurement this Spill uses is anything other than MANHATTAN, you can expect many gaps in the first
447     * filled area.  Subsequent calls to start() with the same entry and a higher volume will expand the area
448     * of the Spill, and are likely to fill any gaps after a few subsequent calls. Increasing the volume slowly
449     * is the best way to ensure that gaps only exist on the very edge if you use a non-MANHATTAN measurement.
450     * <br>
451     * The intended purpose for this method is filling contiguous areas of dungeon with certain terrain features, but it
452     * has plenty of other uses as well.
453     * @param entries key: the first cell for each spiller to spread from. value: the bias toward advancing this key;
454     *                1.0 will always advance, 0.0 will never advance beyond the key, in between will randomly choose
455     * @param volume the total number of cells to attempt to fill; if negative will fill the whole map.
456     * @param impassable a Collection, ideally a Set or GreasedRegion, holding Coord items representing the locations of
457     *                   moving obstacles to a fill that cannot be moved through; null means no obstacles exist.
458     * @return an ArrayList of Points that this will enter, in order starting with entry at index 0, until it
459     * reaches its volume or fills its boundaries completely.
460     */
461    public ArrayList<ArrayList<Coord>> start(OrderedMap<Coord, Double> entries, int volume, Collection<Coord> impassable) {
462        if(!initialized || entries == null) return null;
463        if(volume < 0)
464            volume = Integer.MAX_VALUE;
465        int sz = entries.size();
466        ArrayList<Coord> spillers = new ArrayList<>(entries.keySet());
467        ArrayList<Double>
468                biases = new ArrayList<>(sz);
469        spreadPattern = new ArrayList<>(sz);
470        fresh.clear();
471        filled = 0;
472        boolean hasFresh = false;
473        for (short i = 0; i < sz; i++) {
474            spreadPattern.add(new ArrayList<Coord>(128));
475            OrderedSet<Coord> os = new OrderedSet<Coord>(128);
476            fresh.add(os);
477            Coord c = spillers.get(i);
478            Double d = entries.getAt(i);
479            biases.add(d);
480            if (d <= 0.0001 || c.x < 0 || c.y < 0)
481                continue;
482            spillMap[c.x][c.y] = i;
483            if (impassable == null || !impassable.contains(c)) {
484                os.add(c);
485                hasFresh = true;
486            }
487        }
488
489        Direction[] dirs = (measurement == Measurement.MANHATTAN) ? Direction.CARDINALS : Direction.OUTWARDS;
490
491        while (hasFresh && filled < volume) {
492            hasFresh = false;
493            for (short i = 0; i < spillers.size() && filled < volume; i++) {
494                OrderedSet<Coord> currentFresh = fresh.get(i);
495                if(currentFresh.isEmpty())
496                    continue;
497                else
498                    hasFresh = true;
499                if(rng.nextDouble() < biases.get(i)) {
500                    Coord cell = currentFresh.randomItem(rng);
501                    spreadPattern.get(i).add(cell);
502                    spillMap[cell.x][cell.y] = i;
503                    filled++;
504                    anySpillMap.insert(cell.x, cell.y);
505
506
507                    for (int d = 0; d < dirs.length; d++) {
508                        Coord adj = cell.translate(dirs[d].deltaX, dirs[d].deltaY);
509                        if(!adj.isWithin(width, height))
510                            continue;
511                        double h = heuristic(dirs[d]);
512                        if (physicalMap[adj.x][adj.y] && !anySpillMap.contains(adj.x, adj.y)
513                                && (impassable == null || !impassable.contains(adj))
514                                && rng.nextDouble(h) <= 1.0) {
515                            setFresh(i, adj);
516                        }
517                    }
518                    currentFresh.remove(cell);
519                    anyFreshMap.remove(cell.x, cell.y);
520                }
521            }
522        }
523        return spreadPattern;
524    }
525
526    private static final double root2 = Math.sqrt(2.0);
527    private double heuristic(Direction target) {
528        switch (measurement) {
529            case MANHATTAN:
530            case CHEBYSHEV:
531                return 1.0;
532            case EUCLIDEAN:
533                switch (target) {
534                    case DOWN_LEFT:
535                    case DOWN_RIGHT:
536                    case UP_LEFT:
537                    case UP_RIGHT:
538                        return root2;
539                    default:
540                        return  1.0;
541                }
542        }
543        return 1.0;
544    }
545}
